intro: Draba weberi, commonly known as Weber's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, basal leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in early spring. Draba weberi is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
